addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_UNKNOWN: Command not successful due to Unknown causes
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_SWITCHING_HIERARCHY: Not successful since one of the downstream Loc switches like in CSWI has the value TRUE
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_SELECT_FAILED: Cancelled due to an unsuccessful selection (select service)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_INVALID_POSITION: Control action is aborted due to invalid switch position (Pos in XCBR or XSWI)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_POSITION_REACHED: Switch is already in the intended position (Pos in XCBR or XSWI)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_PARAMETER_CHANGE_IN_EXECUTION: Control action is blocked due to running parameter change
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_STEP_LIMIT: Control action is blocked, because tap changer has reached the limit (EndPosR or EndPosL in YLTC)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_MODE: Control action is blocked, because the LN (CSWI or XCBR/XSWI) is in a mode (Mod) which doesn’t allow any switching
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_PROCESS: Control action is blocked due to some external event at process level that prevents a successful operation, for example blocking indication (EEHealth in XCBR or XSWI)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_INTERLOCKING: Control action is blocked due to interlocking of switching devices (in CILO attribute EnaOpn.stVal=”FALSE” or EnaCls.stVal=”FALSE”)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_SYNCHROCHECK: Control action with synchrocheck is aborted due to exceed of time limit and missing synchronism condition
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_COMMAND_ALREADY_IN_EXECUTION: Control, select or cancel service is rejected, because control action is already running
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_BLOCKED_BY_HEALTH: Control action is blocked due to some internal event that prevents a successful operation (Health)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_1_OF_N_CONTROL: Control action is blocked, because another control action in a domain (for example substation) is already running (in any XCBR or XSWI of that domain, the DPC.stSeld=”TRUE”)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ABORTION_BY_CANCEL: Control action is aborted due to cancel service
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_TIME_LIMIT_OVER: Control action is terminated due to exceed of some time limit
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ABORTION_BY_TRIP: Control action is aborted due to a trip (PTRC with ACT.general=”TRUE”)
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_OBJECT_NOT_SELECTED: Control action is rejected, because control object was not selected
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_OBJECT_ALREADY_SELECTED: Select action is not executed, because the addressed object is already selected
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_NO_ACCESS_AUTHORITY: Control action is blocked due to lack of access authority
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ENDED_WITH_OVERSHOOT: Control action executed but the end position has overshoot
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ABORTION_DUE_TO_DEVIATION: Control action is aborted due to deviation between the command value and the measured value
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ABORTION_BY_COMMUNICATION_LOSS: Control action is aborted due to the loss of connection with the client that issued the control
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_ABORTION_BY_COMMAND: Control action is blocked due to the data attribute CmdBlk.stVal is TRUE
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_INCONSISTENT_PARAMETERS: The parameters between successive control services are not consistent, for example the ctlNum of Select and Operate service are different
addCauseDesc.ADD_CAUSE_LOCKED_BY_OTHER_CLIENT: Another client has already reserved the object
